cyclone.name: ISAIAS
cyclone.current_location: near the north coast of the Dominican Republic, about 45 mi WNW of Puerto Plata
cyclone.trajectory: Moving northwest across the Bahamas and then forecast to ride up the Florida east coast toward Georgia–South Carolina
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: South-east Florida coast (near or just north of Miami)

weather_observation.watch_coast: East coast of Florida from Ocean Reef to Sebastian Inlet (south-east FL)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Northwestern Bahamas (Hurricane Warning) and much of the Bahamas (Tropical-Storm Warning)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire Florida east coast northward to the Carolinas and Mid-Atlantic within 5-day cone
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force gusts (35–45 mph) possible Sunday as the center passes just offshore
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor inundation of 1–3 ft possible along the St. Johns River mouth and adjacent beaches at high tide
weather_observation.rainfall: Outer rainbands may bring 2–4 inches of rain Sunday into early Monday with localized higher totals
weather_observation.other_hazards: High surf, dangerous rip currents and brief tornadoes in spiral rainbands
